author: Ben Harvy
title: Mum gives McDonald’s a spray over water
text:
A MOTHER has branded an Elizabeth McDonald’s eatery as heartless after her hot and dehydrated 14-year-old son was refused a glass of water because he couldn’t pay the 30 cent charge.
Vasu Sharrock, 38, said she was furious when she arrived at Elizabeth railway station in 40C heat to find Kuvam “red as a beetroot”.
She said her son had finished the contents of his water bottle at school and later, dehydrated in the heat, he went to a nearby McDonald’s. “He said ‘can I please have some water for my bottle?” Mrs Sharrock said.
“But they told him it was going to cost 30 cents.”
The youngster said he reached into his bag for his wallet, before realising he had left it at home.
He was then bluntly told: “Sorry we can’t help you.”
Mrs Sharrock said her son pleaded, telling them: “My mum is on the train from Adelaide, she will be here in 20 minutes, can I please have some water and she will pay you. “They said: ‘no, sorry you’ll have to wait’ so he was polite and just walked out.
“He wasn’t asking for soft drink, he wasn’t asking for a thickshake, it was just water.
“It’s a bloody joke and it’s completely unacceptable.
“McDonald’s, a multi-million dollar company all over the world, couldn’t spare 200ml of water in a bottle.”
